q: to a Berlin museum. Egypt's Supreme Council of Antiquities sent the request to the Prussian Cultural Heritage Foundation, which runs the Neues Museum in the German capital where the bust is kept. The foundation's position on the return of Nefertiti remains unchanged, foundation president Professor Hermann Parzinger said in a statement. "She is and remains the ambassador of Egypt in Berlin." to ride out this new round of unwelcome attention. With rumors swirling around Westminster earlier this week that Mr. Andy Coulson had already offered to resign, the prime minister publicly expressed full confidence in his aide. Obviously, when he was editor of the News of the World, bad things happened at the newspaper, and when he found out about those things, he resigned, and that was the right thing to do, Mr. David Cameron told BBC radio's "Today" program. "I judge his work by what he has done" since then, Mr. David Cameron said, adding that Mr. Andy Coulson should not be punished

scandal at one of Britain's sauciest tabloids. The aide, Andy Coulson , had edited News of the World, Britain's biggest-selling Sunday newspaper, until 2007 and shortly after was hired by David Cameron . Unfortunately continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 percent needed in this role, Andy Coulson said in a statement. The resignation is a blow for David Cameron who had repeatedly backed Andy Coulson against calls for his resignation, saying earlier this week that everyone deserved a "second chance."

"It's tough for a House member to run for president," this strategist continues, and it looks like he will waltz into the governorship of Indiana. He must be thinking, "I've got time, and it's a lot easier to run as the governor of Indiana than as a House member from anywhere.' The source close to Mike Pence agrees. As governor, he"ll be able "to build a larger following and donor base" and address "the punditry that says you need executive experience."

Answering one of only a couple of audience questions, Donald Rumsfeld said of the difference between the Iraq War and Vietnam: The Vietnamese were not likely to come and attack the United States of America. Yet the CIA reported in October 2002 that it was unlikely that Iraq would launch any type of chemical or biological attack against America- unless we provoked the regime by attacking them. Indeed,
